radiographic_examinations.findings: White granular opacities, visual acuity decline.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Corneal opacities appeared 12 months or more after LASIK; visual acuity decreased as the number and density of opacities increased.

radiographic_examinations.findings: All patients were heterozygous for the Avellino dystrophy gene.
Granular deposits observed centrally in the interface beneath the flap of both eyes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased number of deposits over time, with manifest refraction worsening.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Numerous granular opacities discovered, 20/30 visual acuity in right eye, 20/40 in left eye.
Granular opacities in the central flap interface in both eyes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Granular opacities increased in density in both eyes.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Numerous fine, white, anterior stromal granular deposits were noted.
Decreased visual acuity and glare observed.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: With treatment, best spectacle-corrected visual acuity improved to 20/20 and remained stable for 6 months.
